original_data.question: A 23-year-old woman comes to the physician because she is embarrassed about the appearance of her nails. She has no history of serious illness and takes no medications. She appears well. A photograph of the nails is shown. Which of the following additional findings is most likely in this patient?
original_data.augmented_question:
Since I don't see the original text, I'll provide a general example of how you could rewrite medical terms using synonyms.

Let's say the original text mentions "physician", "history of serious illness", and "medications".

Original text: A 23-year-old woman comes to the physician because she is embarrassed about the appearance of her nails. She has no history of serious illness and takes no medications. She appears well.

Rewritten text with synonyms:

A 23-year-old woman visits her healthcare provider due to concerns about the appearance of her fingernails. She lacks a record of significant health problems and does not take any prescription drugs. Her overall health is unremarkable.

In this example, I replaced "physician" with "healthcare provider", "history of serious illness" with "record of significant health problems", and "medications" with "prescription drugs".

options.B: Flesh-colored papules in the lumbosacral region
options.D: Holosystolic murmur at the left lower sternal border
